member.name: T:UsbNetDll.CMeaDeviceNet
member.summary: Base class for MEA data acquisition devices.
member.remarks: There are two different device types for MEA data aquistion devices. There are the USB-MEA devices and the MC_Card. In .NET both classes can be accessed by the contructor of the base class CMeaDeviceNet, which contructs the correct underlying C++ class for the USB-MEA device on the one hand or the MC_Card device on the other hand. Through this interface both device types USB-MEA devices and MC_Card devices can be accessed

member.summary: Read data from a FIFO queue in int16 data format
member.param: Handle of the FIFO queue. Either zero when the SetSelectedData call was used or the channel number.
Number of sample frames to read.
Number of sample frames which were read, might be smaller than frames.

member.summary: Read data from a FIFO queue in uint16 data format

Buffer to put the data from the device in.
Position in buffer where to put the data.
Number of sample frames to read.
Number of sample frames which were read, might be smaller than frames.

member.summary: Read data from a FIFO queue in uint16 data format

Number of sample frames to read.

member.name: M:UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.ChannelBlock_AvailFrames(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the number of sample frames already available in the FIFO.
member.param: Handle of the FIFO queue. Either zero when the SetSelectedData call was used or the channel number.

member.name: M:UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SetSelectedChannelsQueue(System.Boolean[],System.Int32,System.Int32,UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SampleSize,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a common FIFO queue for all channels. Data in callback will be a list per channel. Use ChannelBlock_ReadFramesDict... with handle = 0 to read the data.
member.remarks: When using 32 bit data format, ChannelsInBlock is still the number of 16 bit channels per frame, as obtained from GetChannelsInBlock, while nChannels is the number of 32 bit channels to be read from the device. So when all channels from a device are read in 32 bit data format nChannels = ChannelsInBlock/2
member.param: List of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.
Number of sample frames the FIFO must acquire before the callback function is called.
size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.

member.name: M:UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SetSelectedChannelsQueue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SampleSize,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a common FIFO queue for all channels. Data in callback will be a list per channel. Use ChannelBlock_ReadFramesDict... with handle = 0 to read the data.
Create a common queue for all channels.
member.remarks: When using 32 bit data format, ChannelsInBlock is still the number of 16 bit channels per frame, as obtained from GetChannelsInBlock, while nChannels is the number of 32 bit channels to be read from the device. So when all channels from a device are read in 32 bit data format nChannels = ChannelsInBlock/2
member.param: Number of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.
Number of sample frames the FIFO must acquire before the callback function is called.
size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.

So when all channels from a device are read in 32 bit data format nChannels = ChannelsInBlock/2

Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.

size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.

member.summary: Create a common FIFO queue for all channels. Use handle = 0 in the ChannelBlock_ReadFrames... functions.
member.remarks: When using 32 bit data format, ChannelsInBlock is still the number of 16 bit channels per frame, as obtained from GetChannelsInBlock, while nChannels is the number of 32 bit channels to be read from the device. So when all channels from a device are read in 32 bit data format nChannels = ChannelsInBlock/2
member.param: Number of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.

size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.

member.name: M:UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SetSelectedChannels(System.Boolean[],System.Int32,System.Int32,UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SampleSize,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a FIFO queue per channel. Each channel will have its own FIFO and Callback function.
member.remarks: When using a 32bit sample size, the number obtained from GetChannelsInBlock must be devided by 2 to be used here, since GetChannelsInBlock returns the number of 16 bit datapoints per sample frame, while this functions uses the number of sample frames in its own data format.
member.param: List of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.
Number of sample frames the FIFO must acquire before the callback function is called.
size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.

member.name: M:UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SetSelectedChannels(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UsbNetDll.CMcsUsbDacqNet.SampleSize,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a FIFO queue per channel. Each channel will have its own FIFO and Callback function.
member.remarks: When using a 32bit sample size, the number obtained from GetChannelsInBlock must be devided by 2 to be used here, since GetChannelsInBlock returns the number of 16 bit datapoints per sample frame, while this functions uses the number of sample frames in its own data format.
member.param: Number of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.
Number of samples frames the FIFO must acquire before the callback function is called.
size of the datawords, either 16 or 32bit.
value obtained from GetChannelsInBlock.
